abstract: Senate lawmakers urged government officials, in effect, to make banks do something for homeowners in return for the billions that the banks are getting from Washington.
snippet: Senate lawmakers urged government officials, in effect, to make banks do something for homeowners in return for the billions that the banks are getting from Washington.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senators prodded government officials involved in the bank-rescue plan to do more to help struggling homeowners avoid foreclosure and expressed impatience on Thursday over the pace of the unfolding program.

headline.main: Senators Press for Action to Stem Foreclosures
headline.print_headline: Senators Press for Action to Stem Foreclosures

byline.original: By David Stout and Brian Knowlton
